instruction: What kind of spectrum was used on classifying synthetic textile fibers?
Output: Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR) was used to analyze and classify synthetic textile fibers.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on classifying synthetic textile fibers?
Output: Savitzky-Golay and Standard Normal Variate (SNV) preprocessing methods were used on classifying synthetic textile fibers.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the classification model on classifying synthetic textile fibers, and how well did it perform?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the classification model is the percentage of correctly classified test samples. At a significance level of 5%, 97.1% of the test samples were correctly classified. This indicates that the classification model performed well, with a high level of accuracy in classifying the synthetic textile fibers.

instruction: What multivariate statistical methods were used on classifying synthetic textile fibers using Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR) to determine relationships between different fabric fragments found at crime scenes?
Output: The multivariate statistical method used on classifying synthetic textile fibers using Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR) was Principal Component Analysis (PCA).
